data.text: @WiredApe @KoenSwinkels No worries! It's hard to clearly explain some things in so few characters
@BastardsRead @KoenSwinkels Got it and agree 👍 sorry I misunderstood

@WiredApe @KoenSwinkels It doesn't, but it does kill germs. And an immune system that is less exposed to germs (and viruses) is less able to fight off sickness once exposed. 
So I'm wondering if there is an immunity deficit in that population that may be in the process of being filled.

@KoenSwinkels I don't have an answer to this but assuming they have the same non pharmaceutical interventions still in place, the difference is, with Omicron, you have more people infected and more ending in hospital. Plus the vaccines were more efficient against previous variants.
@KoenSwinkels The answer is in the climate.  If you live in a place where there is high density and pollution, you are likely to have  more respiratory diseases in the population.
Interesting comment (first comment) on the Hong Kong situation https://t.co/AfXS5lIaaG https://t.co/PdUevW34xg
@BastardsRead @KoenSwinkels How does hand sanitizer prevent covid?
